objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: Primary author/publisher of the report; also credited as the author in YARA rule metadata and provides findings and recommendations.

objects.name: Malware staging domain (temp.sh)
objects.description: Domain hosting the signed first-stage executable downloaded via spear-phishing redirects.

objects.name: Second-stage delivery domain (journalctl.website)
objects.description: Domain used to download and launch DAMASCENED PEACOCK from the first stage.

objects.name: URL serving DAMASCENED PEACOCK
objects.description: Observed URL used to serve the DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL to victims.

objects.name: C2 domain (apimonger.com)
objects.description: Configured command-and-control domain used by DAMASCENED PEACOCK over HTTP on port 8080.

objects.name: C2 beacon endpoint
objects.description: Beacon endpoint used by DAMASCENED PEACOCK to POST and retrieve the third stage payload (HTTP port 8080).

objects.name: COM hijack registry key
objects.description: Registry key hijacked by DAMASCENED PEACOCK to persist and execute the downloaded final stage within explorer.exe.

objects.name: Downloaded third-stage DLL path
objects.description: Destination path where DAMASCENED PEACOCK writes the final stage before COM hijack execution.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (first-stage downloader) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of signed first-stage executable delivered via spear-phishing and used to fetch DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (first-stage downloader) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of signed first-stage executable delivered via spear-phishing and used to fetch DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (first-stage downloader) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of signed first-stage executable delivered via spear-phishing and used to fetch DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of the DAMASCENED PEACOCK downloader DLL loaded by the first-stage.

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of the DAMASCENED PEACOCK downloader DLL loaded by the first-stage.

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of the DAMASCENED PEACOCK downloader DLL loaded by the first-stage.

objects.name: damascened peacock
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is a lightweight, staged downloader targeting Windows that was observed in a late-2024 spear-phishing campaign against the UK Ministry of Defence. It is a 32-bit DLL with a single export (DllExport) responsible for downloading a final stage and executing it via a COM Hijack in explorer.exe. It uses defense evasion techniques including XOR-based string obfuscation and dynamic API resolution via hashing, communicates over HTTP (port 8080) using WinHTTP APIs, and is configured to beacon to apimonger[.]com.

objects.name: rustyclaw
objects.description: RustyClaw is referenced as a related variant within the wider RomCom malware family. DAMASCENED PEACOCK is described as a stage between RustyClaw and DustyHammock, indicating an evolution of the multi-stage infection chain.

objects.name: snipbot
objects.description: SnipBot is referenced as a related variant within the wider RomCom malware family. DAMASCENED PEACOCK is a variant of RustyClaw and SnipBot, reflecting similar multi-stage behavior.

objects.name: dustyhammock
objects.description: DustyHammock is mentioned as the stage that follows DAMASCENED PEACOCK in the multi-stage chain (DAMASCENED PEACOCK acts between RustyClaw and DustyHammock).

objects.name: romcom
objects.description: RomCom is the broader malware family that includes variants such as RustyClaw, SnipBot, and DAMASCENED PEACOCK. The report positions DAMASCENED PEACOCK as part of this family within a staged infection chain.

objects.name: UK Ministry of Defence (MOD)
objects.description: Target organization of the late-2024 spear-phishing campaign delivering DAMASCENED PEACOCK; also a source referenced in the report.

objects.name: Talos
objects.description: Referenced industry source that previously documented the RustyClaw variant within the RomCom malware family.

objects.name: Palo Alto Networks (Unit 42)
objects.description: Referenced industry source that previously documented the SnipBot variant within the RomCom malware family.

objects.name: FUTURICO LLC
objects.description: Organization named in the code signing certificate used to sign the first-stage loader that downloads and executes DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: GlobalSign nv-sa
objects.description: Certificate Authority listed as the issuer of the EV Code Signing certificate used to sign the first-stage loader.

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Targets a code pattern which is used to resolve
APIs in the first stage which loads DAMASCENED PEACOCK."
        hash1 = "1bd5b9fec7ccc29144989203c3b15a10c9c22a76"

    strings:

    $ = {56 31 C0 85 D2 74 1D 0F B6 31 41 4A 69 F6 [4] 0F AF F6 C1

C6 10 31 C6 0F AF F6 C1 C6 10 89 F0 EB DF 5E C3}
    condition:

    (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

and all of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets a code pattern in DAMASCENED
PEACOCK which sees the resolved pointer for WinHttpConnect retrieved from
a struct, arguments pushed e.g. 8080 as the port, and then a call."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ = {8B 85 90 00 00 00 6A 00 68 90 1F 00 00 FF 76 34 FF 33 FF D0}
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashes
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets the code in DAMASCENED PEACOCK
used for generating an API hash. The rule is agnostic of the constants
used to generate the hash."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ =
{8D0C0669C9[4]8D5201C1C9??81C1[4]03C1C1C8??0FAFC60FBE3203C08BC8C1C8??C1C9
??85F6}
    condition:
        any of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets the original name and export
name in DAMASCENED PEACOCK."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ = "XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll"
        $ = "DllExport"
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: Gather Victim Host Information
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK checks whether the victim host is 32-bit or 64-bit to determine the appropriate next stage to download.

objects.name: Phishing: Spearphishing Link
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage that is delivered via a link in an email.

objects.name: User Execution: Malicious File
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage which is reliant upon the user running the file.

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication: Component Object Model
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK achieves execution for the 3rd stage it downloads by COM Hijacking explorer.exe.

objects.name: Obfuscated/Compressed Files and Information
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK XOR encodes configuration strings used throughout.

objects.name: Obfuscated/Compressed Files and Information: Dynamic API Resolution
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK uses an API hashing algorithm combined with dynamic resolution of Win32 APIs to obfuscate functionality.

objects.name: Subvert Trust Controls: Code Signing
objects.description: The first stage of the malware is signed, meaning DAMASCENED PEACOCK executes within a signed, malicious process.

objects.name: Masquerading
objects.description: The first stage of DAMASCENED PEACOCK is an executable with an icon and filename indicating it is a PDF.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK communicates with the command and control server over HTTP.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Damascened Peacock
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. damascened peacock.
